global-group.name: System Values
global-group.doc: Various internal system values. These are used in all parts of AweMUD.

global.name: TICKS_PER_ROUND
global.doc: Number of game ticks per game round.

global.name: true
global.doc: Use this whenever you need to supply a "true" boolean value. Do *not* use this for comparison.

global.name: false
global.doc: Use this whenever you need to supply a "false" boolean value. Do *not* use this for comparison.

global-group.name: Colors
global-group.doc: These values are color codes that can be inserted into text sent out to players. These values should not be inserted into strings intended to be stored long term or used anywhere other than player output.

global.name: STAT_COUNT
global.doc: The number of stats that exist. (Useful in loops.)

global-group.name: Creature Positions
global-group.doc: These are for use with the and methods.

global-group.name: Entity Name Types
global-group.doc: Entity name types are used with the Entity.get_namef() method. This method allows you to retrieve the entity's name with various formatting applied, including the prefixing of articles. These global values are used to indicate which form of article you desire.

global.name: EN_DEF
global.doc: Definite article version of entity name representation.

global.name: EN_INDEF
global.doc: Indefinite article version of entity name representation.

global.name: EN_NONE
global.doc: No article version of entity name representation.

global-group.name: Object Search Ranges
global-group.doc: The method can be configured to look in different places for the named object. For example, you may search only the ground, only the character's inventory, or every reachable location.

global.name: GOC_EQUIP
global.doc: Only look for held or worn items.

global.name: GOC_FLOOR
global.doc: Only look for items on the floor.

global.name: GOC_SUB
global.doc: Only look for items in containers on the floor.

global.name: GOC_ROOM
global.doc: Only look for items on the floor or in containers on the floor.

global.name: GOC_ANY
global.doc: Look for any equipped or room item.

global-group.name: Object Actions
global-group.doc: s can have various actions attached to them. An action is simply a script with a specific name that is invoked when a tries to use the object in a specific way. The scripts used in object actions must return one of these return values telling the engine what sorts of further processing should be done for the action.

global.name: OBJACT_OK
global.doc: The engine will do any default processing for the action, including printing out default usage messages, and send an event for the action.

global.name: OBJACT_OK_QUIET
global.doc: The engine will do not do any default processing for the action, but it will send an event for the action. Because no default processing is done, players initiating the action will not see any output unless the action script displays something.

global.name: OBJACT_FAIL
global.doc: The engine will print out a default error message for the action. No event is sent.

global.name: OBJACT_FAIL_QUIET
global.doc: The engine will not print out any messages, nor will it send an event for the action. The action script should print out failure messages to the user.

global-group.name: Containers
global-group.doc: s support not only a single container, but can actually have multiple containers. You may store objects inside, on top of, under, or behind other objects. Various methods require that a container be specified, and these are the globals you use to do so.

This is true for other core types that use Time. Scriptix arrays and object properties will store a reference as usual.

method.doc: Restricted skills cannot be bought using the normal methods, although once a player has one or more ranks in the skill, the player may improve skill using the normal methods.

method.name: isLocked

return.doc: True if the skill is locked.

method.doc: Locked skills cannot be bought or improved by the player using the normal methods. Any skill which isLocked returns true for will also return true for isRestricted.

method.name: isIntrinsic

return.doc: True if the skill is an instrinsic ability.

method.doc: Intrinsic skills are usually called 'stats' or 'attributes' in other game systems. Strength or intelligence are examples of intrinsic skills. Intrinsic skills cannot be improved by the player using the normal methods. They are also displayed separately from other skills and are handled differently during character creation. Any skill which isIntrinsic returns true for will also return for for isRestricted and isLocked.

method.name: isSecret

return.doc: True if the skill is secret.

method.doc: Secret skills are locked skills which are hidden from the player entirely. Any skill which isIntrinsic returns true for will also return for for isRestricted and isLocked.

type.name: Iterator
type.doc: Iterators are special values used by the foreach looping statement in Scriptix. Methods and functions returning iterators should only be used as values in foreach loop statements. The data structures that iterators are based on should not be modified while in the foreach loop, as doing so may result in the foreach loop skipping or doubling up on values during its iteration.
